item.title: Patty add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I just got out of the hospital. I was in a speed reading accident. I hit a book mark and flew across the room." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Patty add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Patty add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Patty add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Patty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Patty add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Patty add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Patty add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Patty add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Patty add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Patty add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Patty add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description:
"<b>Introduction to Poetry</b>
I ask them to take a poem and hold it up to the light like a color slide
or press an ear against its hive.
I say drop a mouse into a poem and watch him probe his way out,
or walk inside the poem's room and feel the walls for a light switch.
I want them to waterski across the surface of a poem waving at the author's name on the shore.
But all they want to do is tie the poem to a chair with rope and torture a confession out of it.
They begin beating it with a hose to find out what it really means." -- Billy Collins

item.title: Patty add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patty add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Patty add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Every man is more than just himself; he also represents the unique, the very special and always significant and remarkable point at which the world's phenomena intersect, only once in this way, and never again. That is why every man's story is important, eternal, sacred; that is why every man, as long as he lives and fulfills the will of nature, is wondrous, and worthy of consideration. In each individual the spirit has become flesh, in each man the creation suffers, within each one a redeemer is nailed to the cross." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Patty add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Patty add a quote by Guy de Maupassant
item.description: "Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare." -- Guy de Maupassant
